english: beneficence to the East; grace to the East; marsh-east (lit.); to favor the East (lit.)

etymology.description: 泽(beneficence; favor) + 东(east) = beneficence to the East.
etymology.interpretation: Common as a masculine given name expressing the wish that one’s beneficence or blessings reach the eastern lands. Also usable literally in toponyms as “marsh to the east.”
etymology.simplification: 澤→泽 simplifies the complex phonetic component; 東→东 reduces interior strokes—both to lower stroke count in the PRC character reform.

examples.chinese: 父母给他取名泽东(父母給他取名澤東)，寓意恩泽惠及东方(寓意恩澤惠及東方)。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ gěi tā qǔmíng Zédōng, yùyì ēnzé huìjí dōngfāng.
examples.english: His parents named him Zedong, implying blessings benefiting the East.

examples.chinese: 泽东一词(澤東一詞)在地名里也可表示东边的沼泽(在地名裡也可表示東邊的沼澤)。
examples.pinyin: Zédōng yīcí zài dìmíng lǐ yě kě biǎoshì dōngbiān de zhǎozé.
examples.english: The term Zedong in place names can also mean a marsh to the east.
